key_points: Tiger Woods was involved in a car accident on a stretch of Hawthorne Boulevard in Rancho Palos Verdes.
The area is known for high speeds and has had 13 accidents, four with injuries, from January of the previous year to the date of Woods' crash.
The car Woods was driving, a Genesis GV80, has a black box which investigators will examine for clues about the crash.
Los Angeles County Sheriff Alex Villanueva mentioned that the road's challenging nature could lead to accidents if drivers are not careful.
Woods is not expected to face criminal charges related to the crash, as stated by Villanueva.
L.A. County Supervisor Janice Hahn has called for a safety review of the road following the accident.
Residents say the 45 mph speed limit is often exceeded due to the road's steep and curving nature.
Local resident Grace Crofton confirmed the road's dangerous conditions and her own accident experience.
Pamela Park, a long-time resident, noted the road's decline can catch drivers off-guard.
There is no evidence of impairment on Woods' part, and he is not facing any charges.
